alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Webster (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 12 at 7:33PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Franklin, western Webster, southwestern Adams and southeastern Kearney Counties through 800 PM CDT... At 733 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Upland to 8 miles northeast of Bloomington to near Franklin. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Campbell around 745 PM CDT. Riverton around 750 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Bladen and Inavale. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for north central Kansas...and south central Nebraska.
